channel.title: Posts on Hobbymath42's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Hobbymath42's Blog

item.title: ABN Postcode Extractor (Corporate Tax Transparency Analysis - Part 2)
item.description:
This is Part 2 of a three-part series. You can find the previous part here . :)

Continuing on from the previous part, we are going to jump to another dataset. The previous part contains more technical information around geospatial mapping and not too much of a focus on the data I am trying to analyse.

Hence, this part will have more of a focus on the data I wish to analyse: The 2021-22 Corporate Tax Transparency Report released by the Australian Taxation Office (ATO).

item.title: ASGS GeoNames Pipeline (Corporate Tax Transparency Analysis - Part 1)
item.description:
Alright, time for a new project!

Well, sort of two new projects!

This post specifically is effectively a beginning of sorts, starting out as both the first part of a larger whole, as well as the start of another whole in itself!

The tl;dr of this post is that I wanted to create a pipeline for geospatial analysis of Australian-specific datasets (I’ll get into why this is the case soon enough)!

item.title: Favourite Music Releases Visualiser - Visualisation (Part 2)
item.description:
This is Part 2 of the Favourite Music Releases Visualiser Project Series, see Part 1 if you missed it here !

Continuing on from the previous blog post in this series, with the relevant queries produced and ready for use, it’s time to dive into Python & Streamlit!

Streamlit Directory Structure and Setup

As discussed in the prior post, Streamlit is a framework which can take Python code and turn it into a single page or multi-page web application, without the need for JavaScript or its respective frameworks/libraries.

item.title: Favourite Music Releases Visualiser - The Data (Part 1)
item.description:
So… This is my first proper project that I have completed! (outside of this website)

I have enjoyed listening to music of various genres ever since I can remember!

I will likely make another post about my music listening journey but to keep things short, I wanted a way to keep a list of my favourite music albums, LPs, Soundtracks, etc., in one place!

Hence, this project is my attempt to do so while also gaining some insight into my current music tastes and potentially, identify gaps that I want to fill!
